str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sickle, pruning-hook. From drepo; a gathering hook.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Reaping, harvest; met: the harvest, crop. From therizo; reaping, i.e. The crop.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.
